Comment: Sure, except that Roberts also just ruled that there’s no remedy against the government if they ignore all of that and deport someone against the law. So, sure “they have to have a hearing”, but “we won’t make you do anything even if you ignore us.” Like everything with Roberts, it’s more than just the instant case that looks reasonable, it’s the trajectory: the Court inserting itself in historically early ways when it benefits Trump, then making sure that there aren’t any consequences even when Trump blatantly ignores the law and takes a shit on the Constitution.
